intro: Jatropha brachyadenia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf physic nut, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by capsule fruits containing toxic seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
